cinnamon.engine.system

Class DefaultControlMap

  • java.lang.Object
    • cinnamon.engine.system.DefaultControlMap
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ControlMap

    public class DefaultControlMap
extends Object
implements ControlMap

    This ControlMap implementation assumes one KeyEvent and one MouseEvent is submitted per game tick. Furthermore, only one InputEvent.Action is allowed to be handled per hardware constant, whether KeyEvent.Key or MouseEvent.Button.

    • Constructor Summary

      DefaultControlMap()
      Constructor for a DefaultControlMap.

      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addEvent(KeyEvent event)
      Adds a KeyEvent to update the state of the corresponding KeyEvent.Key.
      void addEvent(MouseEvent event)
      Adds a MouseEvent to update the state of the corresponding MouseEvent.Button.
      KeyEventHandler attach(KeyEvent.Key key, KeyEventHandler handler)
      Attaches a KeyEventHandler to a KeyEvent.Key to be executed the next time the appropriate KeyEvent is set when ControlMap.fire() is called.
      MouseEventHandler attach(MouseEvent.Button button, MouseEventHandler handler)
      Attaches a MouseEventHandler to a MouseEvent.Button to be executed the next time the appropriate MouseEvent is set when ControlMap.fire() is called.
      KeyEventHandler detach(KeyEvent.Key key)
      Detaches a KeyEventHandler from the given KeyEvent.Key.
      MouseEventHandler detach(MouseEvent.Button button)
      Detaches an MouseEventHandler from the given MouseEvent.Button.
      void fire()
      Executes all attached EventHandlers whose desired firing state has been satisfied by the most recent InputEvents set through either ControlMap.addEvent(KeyEvent) or ControlMap.addEvent(MouseEvent).
      KeyEvent getKey()
      Gets the most recent KeyEvent.
      MouseEvent getMouse()
      Gets the most recent MouseEvent.
      void setMode(KeyEvent.Key key, boolean fireOnPress, boolean repeatable)
      Sets a KeyEvent.Key to fire on InputEvent.Action.PRESS or InputEvent.Action.RELEASE and whether PRESS events for the Key should generate subsequent InputEvent.Action.REPEAT events.
      void setMode(MouseEvent.Button button, boolean fireOnPress, boolean repeatable)
      Sets a MouseEvent.Button to fire on InputEvent.Action.PRESS or InputEvent.Action.RELEASE and whether PRESS events for the Button should generate subsequent InputEvent.Action.REPEAT events.

    • Method Detail

      • addEvent

        public void addEvent(KeyEvent event)
        Description copied from interface: ControlMap

        Adds a KeyEvent to update the state of the corresponding KeyEvent.Key. A KeyEventHandler attached to the KeyEvent.Key may be executed on the next call to ControlMap.fire(), depending on the Key's fire mode.

        Specified by:
        addEvent in interface ControlMap
        Parameters:
        event - KeyEvent.

      • addEvent

        public void addEvent(MouseEvent event)
        Description copied from interface: ControlMap

        Adds a MouseEvent to update the state of the corresponding MouseEvent.Button. A MouseEventHandler attached to the MouseEvent.Button may be executed on the next call to ControlMap.fire(), depending on the Button's fire mode.

        Specified by:
        addEvent in interface ControlMap
        Parameters:
        event - MouseEvent.

      • attach

        public KeyEventHandler attach(KeyEvent.Key key,
                              KeyEventHandler handler)
        Description copied from interface: ControlMap

        Attaches a KeyEventHandler to a KeyEvent.Key to be executed the next time the appropriate KeyEvent is set when ControlMap.fire() is called.

        Specified by:
        attach in interface ControlMap
        Parameters:
        key - keyboard key.
        handler - KeyEventHandler to fire.
        Returns:
        previously set KeyEventHandler, or null if none was set.

      • attach

        Parameters:

        Returns:

        detach in interface ControlMap

      • fire

        public void fire()
        Description copied from interface: ControlMap

        Executes all attached EventHandlers whose desired firing state has been satisfied by the most recent InputEvents set through either ControlMap.addEvent(KeyEvent) or ControlMap.addEvent(MouseEvent).

        If a KeyEvent.Key or MouseEvent.Button is set as repeatable, and it's current InputEvent.Action is InputEvent.Action.PRESS, then this method will generate a corresponding InputEvent.Action.REPEAT KeyEvent.

        Specified by:
        fire in interface ControlMap

      • getKey

        public KeyEvent getKey()
        Description copied from interface: ControlMap

        Gets the most recent KeyEvent.

        Specified by:
        getKey in interface ControlMap
        Returns:
        KeyEvent.

      • getMouse

        public MouseEvent getMouse()
        Description copied from interface: ControlMap

        Gets the most recent MouseEvent.

        Specified by:
        getMouse in interface ControlMap
        Returns:
        MouseEvent.

      • setMode

        public void setMode(KeyEvent.Key key,
                    boolean fireOnPress,
                    boolean repeatable)
        Description copied from interface: ControlMap

        Sets a KeyEvent.Key to fire on InputEvent.Action.PRESS or InputEvent.Action.RELEASE and whether PRESS events for the Key should generate subsequent InputEvent.Action.REPEAT events.

        Specified by:
        setMode in interface ControlMap
        Parameters:
        key - keyboard key.
        fireOnPress - true to fire KeyEventHandlers on PRESS events, false for RELEASE.
        repeatable - true to generate REPEAT events after a PRESS.

      • setMode

        public void setMode(MouseEvent.Button button,
                    boolean fireOnPress,
                    boolean repeatable)
        Description copied from interface: ControlMap

        Sets a MouseEvent.Button to fire on InputEvent.Action.PRESS or InputEvent.Action.RELEASE and whether PRESS events for the Button should generate subsequent InputEvent.Action.REPEAT events.

        Specified by:
        setMode in interface ControlMap
        Parameters:
        button - mouse button.
        fireOnPress - true to fire MouseEventHandlers on PRESS events, false for RELEASE.
        repeatable - true to generate REPEAT events after a PRESS.
